#13013

Prove that a bounded, a.e. continuous function is integrable on a box, generalizing (and re-proving as a corollary) BoxIntegral.integrable_of_continuousOn. Also prove the corresponding generalization of MeasureTheory.ContinuousOn.hasBoxIntegral.

Also define the oscillation of a function at a point and prove some simple lemmas, which are used in the proof above.
Can I ping again for this PR? It is a PR by a new contributor that it is very nice by itself and furthermore will be very useful later on for number theorists.
I think the only person having thought about this box integral thing is @Yury G. Kudryashov
I still wrote two comments to give more time to Yury.
